Debt.origin: [Old French dette , ultimately from Latin debita , plural of debitum debt, from neuter of debitus , past participle of debere to owe]

sub_terms.a: a specific sum of money or a performance due another esp. by agreement (as a loan agreement) [to pay the…of the United States "art. I"] [a for alimony]
sub_terms.b: an obligation to pay or perform on another's claim [discharged the ] compare,

1.note: It is often up to the courts to decide what is or is not a debt under various laws. Courts disagree whether criminal restitution is a debt under the Bankruptcy Code. The historical practice of imprisoning debtors for nonpayment is no longer used.

antecedent debt.definition: debt that is incurred prior to a property transfer paying or securing the debt compare

bad debt.definition: a debt that cannot be collected
bad debt.note: An income tax deduction is allowed for bad debts.

consumer debt.definition: debt that is incurred by an individual primarily for the purchase of consumer goods or services compare

judgment debt.definition: a debt established by a judgment and enforceable by a legal process (as an execution of judgment or attachment)

sub_terms.d: the aggregate of money owed [the national ]

2.definition: the common-law action for the recovery of a specified sum of money or a sum that can be simply and certainly determined called alsocompare,
